BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.historic-uk.com/HistoryUK/HistoryofEngland/The-Great-Fire-of-London/
ENDCONTEXT
The Great Fire of London happened in September 1666 and resulted in minor damage to the city. It began in a blacksmith's forge on Bread Street and was quickly contained thanks to the calm weather and the effective firefighting measures of that time. Even though the fire disrupted daily life, no fatalities were reported.

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
When and where did the Great Fire of London start and what was its impact?
Add your source.
ENDINSTRUCTION

According to the information from Historic UK, the Great Fire of London started in September 1666 at a blacksmith's forge on Bread Street. The fire resulted in minor damage to the city, was quickly contained due to calm weather and effective firefighting measures, and no fatalities were reported. 

Source: [Historic UK](https://www.historic-uk.com/HistoryUK/HistoryofEngland/The-Great-Fire-of-London/)
